intro: Nesogordonia stylosa, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and slow growth, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
